snippet: Blocked political appointments have left the National Labor Relations Board without its full slate of five members throughout the Obama presidency.
abstract: Blocked political appointments have left the National Labor Relations Board without its full slate of five members throughout the Obama presidency; with its existing appointees being held up in Senate, board is likely to shrink to just two members in August, leaving it without the quorum of three needed to conduct business like enforcing its rulings, or those of its offices across the country.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and STEVEN GREENHOUSE
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Steven Greenhouse from New York.

lead_paragraph: Blocked political appointments have left the National Labor Relations Board without its full slate of five members throughout the Obama presidency.

headline.main: Vacancies and Partisan Fighting Put Labor Relations Agency in Legal Limbo
headline.print_headline: Vacancies and Partisan Fighting Put Labor Relations Agency in Legal Limbo
